alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 19 at 10:11PM MST until August 19 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Eastern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 1115 PM MST/1115 PM PDT/. * At 1010 PM MST/1010 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Mohawk to 9 miles northwest of Tyson to 8 miles southeast of Yuma Proving Ground to 17 miles north of Martinez Lake, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 75. CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 78 and 96. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 86. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Somerton, Martinez Lake, Gadsden, Fortuna Foothills, San Luis, Wellton, Tacna, Paloma, Algodones Dunes, Winterhaven, Araby and Yuma Proving Ground. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
